snippet: The S.&P. 500 had its third straight loss despite the European Central Bank’s cut in its benchmark interest rate to a record low.
abstract: Markets decline, dragged down by falling oil prices despite an interest rate cut by the European Central Bank; drop pushes Standard & Poor's 500-stock index to its third consecutive loss.
lead_paragraph: The S.&P. 500 had its third straight loss despite the European Central Bank’s cut in its benchmark interest rate to a record low.

headline.main: Market Gives Up Gains as Oil Slumps
headline.print_headline: Market Gives Up Gains as Oil Slumps
